com.mokiat.data.front.scanner

Interface IMTLScannerHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MTLLimitingScannerHandler

    public interface IMTLScannerHandler
    Users should implement this interface and pass it to the IMTLScanner methods in order to receive events during the parsing of an MTL file.
    Author:
    Momchil Atanasov

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

    • Method Detail

      • onComment

        void onComment(String comment)
        throws WFException
        Called when a comment section (#) has been read.
        Parameters:
        comment - the comment.
        Throws:
        WFException - can be thrown by users to terminate any further scanning of the resource.

      • onMaterial

        void onMaterial(String name)
         throws WFException
        Called when a material definition (newmtl) has been read.

        The material name will not be null.

        Parameters:
        name - name of the material
        Throws:
        WFException - can be thrown by users to terminate any further scanning of the resource.

      • onAmbientColorRGB

        void onAmbientColorRGB(IFastFloat r,
                       IFastFloat g,
                       IFastFloat b)
                throws WFException
        Called when an ambient color definition (Ka) has been read and it specifies an RGB model of the color.

        The specification allows for the MTL resource to specify only Red component in which case the others should be considered the same. Depending on the implementation of this interface, it is possible that it will always do this resolution on itself or it may decide to leave it to the user.
        The former provides easier usage, whereas the latter provides unaltered resource input.

        Parameters:
        r - the Red value, will not be null.
        g - the Green value, will be null if unavailable.
        b - the Blue value, will be null if unavailable.
        Throws:
        WFException - can be thrown by users to terminate any further scanning of the resource.

      • onDiffuseColorRGB

        void onDiffuseColorRGB(IFastFloat r,
                       IFastFloat g,
                       IFastFloat b)
                throws WFException
        Called when a diffuse color definition (Kd) has been read and it specifies an RGB model of the color.

        The specification allows for the MTL resource to specify only Red component in which case the others should be considered the same. Depending on the implementation of this interface, it is possible that it will always do this resolution on itself or it may decide to leave it to the user.
        The former provides easier usage, whereas the latter provides unaltered resource input.

        Parameters:
        r - the Red value, will not be null.
        g - the Green value, will be null if unavailable.
        b - the Blue value, will be null if unavailable.
        Throws:
        WFException - can be thrown by users to terminate any further scanning of the resource.

      • onSpecularColorRGB

        void onSpecularColorRGB(IFastFloat r,
                        IFastFloat g,
                        IFastFloat b)
                 throws WFException
        Called when a specular reflectivity color definition (Ks) has been read and it specifies an RGB model of the color.

        The specification allows for the MTL resource to specify only Red component in which case the others should be considered the same. Depending on the implementation of this interface, it is possible that it will always do this resolution on itself or it may decide to leave it to the user.
        The former provides easier usage, whereas the latter provides unaltered resource input.

        Parameters:

        b - the Blue value, will be null if unavailable.
        Throws:
        WFException - can be thrown by users to terminate any further scanning of the resource.

      • onTransmissionColorRGB

        void onTransmissionColorRGB(IFastFloat r,
                            IFastFloat g,
                            IFastFloat b)
                     throws WFException
        Called when a transmission filter color definition (Tf) has been read and it specifies an RGB model of the color.

        The specification allows for the MTL resource to specify only Red component in which case the others should be considered the same. Depending on the implementation of this interface, it is possible that it will always do this resolution on itself or it may decide to leave it to the user.
        The former provides easier usage, whereas the latter provides unaltered resource input.

        Parameters:
        r - the Red value, will not be null.
        g - the Green value, will be null if unavailable.
        b - the Blue value, will be null if unavailable.
        Throws:
        WFException - can be thrown by users to terminate any further scanning of the resource.

      • onDissolve

        void onDissolve(IFastFloat amount)
         throws WFException
        Called when a dissolve statement (d) has been read.

        Dissolve can be better considered as opacity, where a value of 0 indicates full transparency and a value of 1 indicates full opacity.

        Parameters:
        amount - the dissolve amount, will not be null.
        Throws:
        WFException - can be thrown by users to terminate any further scanning of the resource.

      • onSpecularExponent

        void onSpecularExponent(IFastFloat amount)
                 throws WFException
        Called when a specular exponent statement (Ns) has been read.

        The passed exponent value would generally be a number from 0 to 1000.

        Parameters:
        amount - the specular exponent amount, will not be null.
        Throws:
        WFException - can be thrown by users to terminate any further scanning of the resource.
